column1: Bosscat Kitchen & Libations////This place is extremely picturesque
column2: and the vibe is cool. Service was fast
column3: knowledgeable and friendly. We went for Sunday brunch
column4: and there was good live music. The bosscat fries were thick steak fries which had a homemade sauce - but werent particularly special. The meatloaf hash was delicious
column7: and the best part of the meal. We were warned by our server that the king pancakes were really sweet -- but we made the mistake of not listening since I have a huge sweet tooth. Unfortunately
column8: the item that is so beautiful and caught our eye in the first place
column9: had way too many flavors going on. It wasn't necessarily too sweet
column10: but it was something to skip entirely. I still would like to try the place for dinner because the menu stilled sounded impressive even if brunch was okay.
